results.title: Metformin Attenuates UVA-Induced Skin Photoaging by Suppressing Mitophagy and the PI3K/AKT/mTOR Pathway
results.text_hl: The treatment of Kunming @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@ with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@MF@@@ at a dose of 10 mg/kg/day significantly reduced UVA-induced skin roughness, @DISEASE_Thinness @DISEASE_MESH:D013851 @@@epidermal thinning@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Collagen_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003095 @@@collagen@@@ degradation, and skin aging.

citations.NLM: Chen Q, Zhang H, Yang Y, Zhang S, Wang J, Zhang D, Yu H. Metformin Attenuates UVA-Induced Skin Photoaging by Suppressing Mitophagy and the PI3K/AKT/mTOR Pathway Int J Mol Sci. 2022 Jun 23;23(13):. PMID: 35805987
citations.BibTeX: @article{35805987, title={Metformin Attenuates UVA-Induced Skin Photoaging by Suppressing Mitophagy and the PI3K/AKT/mTOR Pathway}, author={Chen Q and Zhang H and Yang Y and Zhang S and Wang J and Zhang D and Yu H}, journal={Int J Mol Sci}, volume={23}, number={13}}

results.title: Metformin treatment reverses high fat diet- induced non-alcoholic fatty liver diseases and dyslipidemia by stimulating multiple antioxidant and anti-inflammatory pathways
results.text_hl: Consistent with the biochemical and gene expression data, the histopathological examination unveiled that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ treatment attenuated @DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@ cells infiltration, @DISEASE_Fatty_Liver @DISEASE_MESH:D005234 @@@steatosis@@@, hepatocyte @DISEASE_Necrosis @DISEASE_MESH:D009336 @@@necrosis@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Collagen_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003095 @@@collagen@@@ deposition, and @DISEASE_Fibrosis @DISEASE_MESH:D005355 @@@fibrosis@@@ in the liver of HFD fed @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@.

citations.NLM: Yasmin T, Rahman MM, Khan F, Kabir F, Nahar K, Lasker S, Islam MD, Hossain MM, Hasan R, Rana S, Alam MA. Metformin treatment reverses high fat diet- induced non-alcoholic fatty liver diseases and dyslipidemia by stimulating multiple antioxidant and anti-inflammatory pathways Biochem Biophys Rep. 2021 Dec;28():101168. PMID: 34825068
